channel.title: Help please loggin in problems
channel.description:
well im using the client galkons base and the Mithscape_508 source and i need help because when i try to log in(im the hoster) it says: please choose a different world(that happens if i use the no-ip ip) or it tries to log in but doesnt and says error and says on the black screen of the rs source : connection received from: 127.0.0.1
can someone please tell me how to fix this i tried finding everywhere lol
oh and one more question do i have to put my ip on any place of the runescape source? (thats just a question i have because some other games private server source usually need to)
so please help me :confused: respond here please and if u can help me by msn it will be welcome also :P my msn is gabrielbrmu@hotmail.com ;D

item.title: Help please loggin in problems
item.dc:creator: @ninjaxr ninjaxr
item.description:
@ninjaxr wrote:

tha[quote=“jamessemple, post:2, topic:305465”]ok so it says 127.0.0.1 meaning your no-ip config is screwed so open up your no-ip folder and next to the red “no” sign there should be a .txt file that says DUC-(your username) and open that up and it will have your remote no-ip loggings from your ip.

If there are no recordings of updated ips then open up the no-ip DUC application and hit update and enter your ip thing you want. Make sure it has a smiley face next to it.

Hope this helped
—james—[/quote]
thanks man i knew that already tho but thanks for responding oh and i discovered what was the problem it was that the client that i was using wasnt working for that source but thanks anyway

PS: i didnt know clients could not work lol oh and do you know any good hd clients that arent full screen that work with mithscape? that is not the 508 client with ip changer or how to make galkons client base work with it ? if so please tell me i would apreciate it very much

Read full topic

item.title: Help please loggin in problems
item.dc:creator: @jamessemple jamessemple
item.description:
@jamessemple wrote:

ok so it says 127.0.0.1 meaning your no-ip config is screwed so open up your no-ip folder and next to the red “no” sign there should be a .txt file that says DUC-(your username) and open that up and it will have your remote no-ip loggings from your ip.

If there are no recordings of updated ips then open up the no-ip DUC application and hit update and enter your ip thing you want. Make sure it has a smiley face next to it.

Hope this helped
—james—

Read full topic
